speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Daily Restoration
paragraph_text: We gather this beautiful Sabbath morning to speak of Christ, rejoice in His gospel, and support and sustain one another as we walk in “the way” of our Savior. 1

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Daily Restoration
paragraph_text: As members of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints, we assemble for this purpose every Sabbath day throughout the year. If you are not a member of the Church, we welcome you most warmly and thank you for joining with us to worship the Savior and learn of Him. Like you, we are striving—though imperfectly—to become better friends, neighbors, and human beings, 2 and we seek to do this by following our Exemplar, Jesus Christ.

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Daily Restoration
paragraph_text: We hope you can feel the sincerity of our testimony. Jesus Christ lives! He is the Son of the living God, and He directs prophets on the earth in our day. We invite all to come, hear the word of God, and partake of His goodness! I bear my personal witness that God is among us and that He will surely draw near to all who draw near to Him. 3

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Daily Restoration
paragraph_text: We consider it an honor to walk with you in the Master’s strait and narrow path of discipleship.

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Daily Restoration
paragraph_text: There is an oft-repeated theory that people who are lost walk in circles. Not long ago, scientists at the Max Planck Institute for Biological Cybernetics tested that theory. They took participants to a thick forest and gave them simple instructions: “Walk in a straight line.” There were no visible landmarks. The test subjects had to rely solely on their sense of direction.

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Daily Restoration
paragraph_text: How do you think they did?

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Daily Restoration
paragraph_text: The scientists concluded, “People really [do] walk in circles when they do not have reliable cues to their walking direction.” 4 When questioned afterwards, some participants self-confidently claimed that they had not deviated in the slightest. Despite their high confidence, GPS data showed that they walked in loops as tight as 20 meters in diameter.

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Daily Restoration
paragraph_text: Why do we have such a hard time walking in a straight line? Some researchers hypothesize that small, seemingly insignificant deviations in terrain make the difference. Others have pointed to the fact that we all have one leg that is slightly stronger than the other. “More likely,” however, we struggle to walk straight ahead “[because] of increasing uncertainty about where straight ahead is.” 5

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Daily Restoration
paragraph_text: Whatever the cause, it is human nature: without reliable landmarks, we drift off course.

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Daily Restoration
paragraph_text: Isn’t it interesting how small, seemingly insignificant factors can make a major difference in our lives?

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Daily Restoration
paragraph_text: I know this from personal experience as a pilot. Every time I started the approach to an airport, I knew that much of my remaining work would consist of making constant minor course corrections to safely direct the aircraft to our desired landing runway.

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Daily Restoration
paragraph_text: You might have a similar experience when driving a vehicle. Wind, road irregularities, imperfect wheel alignment, inattentiveness—not to mention the actions of other drivers—all can push you off your intended path. Fail to pay attention to these factors and you may end up having a bad day. 6

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Daily Restoration
paragraph_text: This applies to us physically.

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Daily Restoration
paragraph_text: It also applies to us spiritually.

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Daily Restoration
paragraph_text: Most of the changes in our spiritual lives—both positive and negative—happen gradually, a step at a time. Like the participants in the Max Planck study, we may not realize when we veer off course. We may even have high confidence that we are walking a straight line. But the fact is that without the help of landmarks to guide us, we inevitably deviate off course and end up in places we never thought we would be.

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Daily Restoration
paragraph_text: This is true for individuals. It is also true for societies and nations. The scriptures are filled with examples.

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Daily Restoration
paragraph_text: The book of Judges records that after Joshua died, “there arose another generation … which knew not the Lord, nor yet the works which he had done for Israel.” 7

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Daily Restoration
paragraph_text: Despite the astonishing heavenly interventions, visitations, rescues, and miraculous victories the children of Israel witnessed during the lifetimes of Moses and Joshua, within a generation the people had abandoned the Way and began walking according to their own desires. And, of course, it did not take long before they paid the price for that behavior.

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Daily Restoration
paragraph_text: Sometimes this falling away takes generations. Sometimes it happens in a matter of years or even months. 8 But we are all susceptible. No matter how strong our spiritual experiences have been in the past, as human beings we tend to wander. That has been the pattern from the days of Adam until now.

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Daily Restoration
paragraph_text: But all is not lost. Unlike the wandering test subjects, we have reliable, visible landmarks that we can use to evaluate our course.

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Daily Restoration
paragraph_text: And what are these landmarks?

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Daily Restoration
paragraph_text: Surely they include daily prayer and pondering the scriptures and using inspired tools like Come, Follow Me . Each day, we can approach the throne of God in humility and honesty. We can ponder our actions and review the moments of our day—considering our will and desires in light of His. If we have drifted, we plead with God to restore us, and we commit to do better.

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Daily Restoration
paragraph_text: This time of introspection is an opportunity for recalibration. It is a garden of reflection where we can walk with the Lord and be instructed, edified, and purified by the written and Spirit-revealed word of our Heavenly Father. It is a sacred time when we remember our solemn covenants to follow the gentle Christ, when we assess our progress and align ourselves with the spiritual landmarks God has provided for His children.

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Daily Restoration
paragraph_text: Think of it as your personal, daily restoration . On our journey as pilgrims on the path of glory, we know how easy it is to fall away. But just as minor deviations can draw us out of the Savior’s Way, so too can small and simple acts of realignment assuredly lead us back. When darkness creeps into our lives, as it often does, our daily restoration opens our hearts to heavenly light, which illuminates our souls, chasing away shadows, fears, and doubts.

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Daily Restoration
paragraph_text: If we seek it, surely “God shall give unto [us] knowledge by his Holy Spirit, yea, by the unspeakable gift of the Holy Ghost.” 9 As often as we ask, He will teach us the Way and help us follow it.

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Daily Restoration
paragraph_text: This, of course, takes a steady effort on our part. We cannot be content with spiritual experiences of the past. We need a steady flow.

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Daily Restoration
paragraph_text: We can’t rely on others’ testimonies forever. We must build our own.

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Daily Restoration
paragraph_text: We need an ongoing, daily infusion of heavenly light.

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Daily Restoration
paragraph_text: We need “times of refreshing.” 10 Times of personal restoration.

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Daily Restoration
paragraph_text: “Rolling waters” cannot long “remain impure.” 11 To keep our thoughts and actions pure, we have to keep rolling!

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Daily Restoration
paragraph_text: After all, the Restoration of the gospel and the Church is not something that happened once and is over. It is an ongoing process —one day at a time, one heart at a time.

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Daily Restoration
paragraph_text: As our days go, so go our lives. One author put it this way: “A day is like a whole life. You start out doing one thing, but end up doing something else, plan to run an errand, but never get there. … And at the end of your life, your whole existence has that same haphazard quality, too. Your whole life has the same shape as a single day.” 12

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Daily Restoration
paragraph_text: Do you want to change the shape of your life?

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Daily Restoration
paragraph_text: Change the shape of your day.

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Daily Restoration
paragraph_text: Do you want to change your day?

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Daily Restoration
paragraph_text: Change this hour.

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Daily Restoration
paragraph_text: Change what you think, feel, and do at this very moment.

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Daily Restoration
paragraph_text: A small rudder can steer a large ship. 13

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Daily Restoration
paragraph_text: Small bricks can become magnificent mansions.

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Daily Restoration
paragraph_text: Small seeds can become towering sequoias.

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Daily Restoration
paragraph_text: Minutes and hours well spent are the building blocks of a life well lived. They can inspire goodness, lift us from the captivity of imperfections, and lead us upward to the redemptive path of forgiveness and sanctification.

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Daily Restoration
paragraph_text: With you, I lift my heart in gratitude for the magnificent gift of new opportunity, new life, new hope.

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Daily Restoration
paragraph_text: We lift our voices in praise of our bountiful and forgiving God. For surely He is a God of new beginnings. The sublime end of all His labor is to help us, His children, succeed in our quest for immortality and eternal life. 14

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Daily Restoration
paragraph_text: We can become new creatures in Christ, for God has promised, “As often as my people repent will I forgive them their trespasses against me” 15 and “remember them no more.” 16

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Daily Restoration
paragraph_text: My beloved brothers and sisters, dear friends, we all drift from time to time.

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Daily Restoration
paragraph_text: But we can get back on course. We can navigate our way through the darkness and trials of this life and find our way back to our loving Heavenly Father if we seek and accept the spiritual landmarks He has provided, embrace personal revelation, and strive for daily restoration . This is how we become true disciples of our beloved Savior, Jesus Christ.

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Daily Restoration
paragraph_text: As we do so, God will smile upon us. “The Lord shall … bless thee in the land which the Lord thy God giveth thee. The Lord shall establish thee an holy people unto himself.” 17

speaker: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf
role: Of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Daily Restoration
paragraph_text: That we will seek daily restoration and continually strive to walk in the Way of Jesus Christ is my prayer. In the name of Jesus Christ, amen.
